title: Status bar not hiding in fullscreen video after updating to Firefox 138.0.1 (64-bit) on Windows
content:
Hello,

I recently updated my Firefox browser to the latest version, 138.0.1 (64-bit), on Windows.

After the update, I noticed that when playing videos in fullscreen mode (for example, on YouTube or other video websites), the Windows taskbar (the bar at the bottom of the screen with the Start menu icon) does not hide automatically. This is affecting my fullscreen viewing experience.

Before updating to version 138.0.1, the Windows taskbar would hide correctly when entering fullscreen video.

I was wondering if anyone else has encountered a similar issue with the Windows taskbar not hiding, or if there are any suggested solutions to help resolve this problem.

Thank you for your help!

title: Firefox v Firefox Developer render differently
content:
I'm a webmaster looking after a few websites. I recently installed Firefox Developer to do my website work on, mostly so I could shut down regular FF when FB calls my name too persistently. haha

I discovered yesterday when working on a client's site that FF Dev and FF Regular render some CSS differently. I have CSS that will thicken a border line around an image when you hover over it. It's done using a combination of padding-width and border-width.

In FF Dev it's fine and in other browsers it's also fine (Edge, Chrome), but in FF Reg it jumps. I've tried fiddling with the CSS but if I get it so that it works in FF Reg, it's messed up and jumpy in FF Dev. So it seems the two FFs render CSS differently, which seems very odd. Wouldn't they use the same rendering engine?

Is there a way to get around this? It's really frustrating because most visitors will be using FF Reg if they use FF at all.

You can see the effect when you hover over the intro images in the Featured and Suggested Article sections on the Home page of my client's site.

Many thanks in advance for the help.

title: The new feature Tab Groups is absent from Mozilla, instruction page misleading
content:
After updating to version 138.0, the browser put up an announcement page that informed me that I now have access to a great new feature, tab groups. It's actually a great addition to the browser IMO.

But it's absent. I read the announcement page, then the help page it links to. Every description is inapplicable to my browser, there us no drag-over behavior for tabs, there is no "add tab to new group" option when right clicking. I updated to 138.0.1, same thing. There is a topic in Connect.mozilla.org about tab groups as a beta feature, and it's been up in beta since March. But my browser does not have it.

Granted, the help page vaguely says that no all users will see this feature as it's rolled out gradually until May 6th. But why then tell me that I already have it on update? And why is it rolled out gradually if it's already been in beta?

title: Airport Administration Systems all freeze after last update
content:
Good morning, I have about 11 airports in the Netherlands using an administrative system. 30th of april firefox run an update (Firefox 138.0 (20250421163656)) and all systems using firefox now systematically freeze sometimes up to 20 seconds after DOM updates. Especially when they press multiple buttons with function updating entire tables

Which seem to be related to if the DOM is being updated and it is triggered while still updating, it just freezes instantly.

Tested on Firefox with about 30 rows in a table.

E.g.

/** 

* Toggles the visibility of paid and incomplete rows in the register table. * When activated, it hides rows that are marked as paid or incomplete. * When deactivated, it shows all rows again. * * Also updates toggle button states, re-applies the register filter, * and maintains register focus state. * * @param {HTMLElement} element - The element that triggered the toggle (unused, retained for compatibility). */

function registerTogglePaymentList(element) { 

   const registerMainBody = document.getElementById("registerMainBody");    const thisToggleButton = document.getElementById("paymentListToggleButton");    const trafficToggleButton = document.getElementById("trafficListToggleButton");    const rows = registerMainBody.rows;    const toggleState = thisToggleButton.getAttribute("data-toggle"); 
   requestAnimationFrame(() => {        if (toggleState === "on") {            const rowCount = rows.length; 
           for (let i = 0; i < rowCount; i++) {                const row = rows[i];                const isSaved = row.getAttribute("data-saved") !== "false";                const isPaid = row.getAttribute("data-paid") === "1";                const isComplete = row.getAttribute("data-complete") === "true"; 
               row.style.display = ""; 
               if (isSaved) {                    // Uncomment if necessary                    // registerCheckRow(row);                    if (isPaid || !isComplete) {                        row.style.display = "none";                    }                }            } 
           thisToggleButton.setAttribute("data-toggle", "off");            trafficToggleButton.setAttribute("data-toggle", "on");        } else {            App.setRegisterFocusPos(); 
           const rowCount = rows.length;            for (let i = 0; i < rowCount; i++) {                rows[i].style.display = "";            } 
           thisToggleButton.setAttribute("data-toggle", "on");            trafficToggleButton.setAttribute("data-toggle", "on");        } 
       // Reapply filters and restore focus        registerFilterSet(App.registerFilterDirection, App.registerFilter);        App.getRegisterFocusElement(true);    });

}

title: poe ai assistance
content: Digicel's campaign is strategically designed to cater to a diverse range of target audiences. First and foremost, the campaign aims to reach underserved communities where affordable internet access is scarce. By focusing on these communities, Digicel seeks to bridge the digital divide and empower individuals with access to online resources and information that are essential in today's world. In addition, the campaign is particularly suited to address the needs of students and young professionals who rely heavily on data for work and studies. As demand for online classes and remote working continues to rise, providing steady and reasonably priced connectivity solutions to this segment of individuals is essential. Targeting this group enables Digicel to support their work and studies, hence their success in a more digitized context. Moreover, active social media users who engage in online discussions and content are another key target market for Digicel's campaign. They are an active online community that welcomes being connected, sharing, and communicating in their online discussions. By offering them customized solutions and services, Digicel will be capable of enhancing their online experience and giving them the connectivity they need to participate effectively in their online discussions. Lastly, Digicel's campaign targets small businesses and entrepreneurs seeking low-cost connectivity for business growth. To appreciate these businesses' desires, especially regarding connectivity costs, Digicel aims to become a reliable partner that can provide low-cost and reliable internet solutions. By doing so, businesses can expand their online presence, acquire new customers, and drive business growth in the current competitive digital economy. bold text

title: [BUG] Why does the vertical tab bar always scroll to the top when pinned tab exists?
content: When the vertical tab bar is enabled, if there are no pinned tabs, when the mouse hovers over the vertical tab bar, the scrollbar will be in the exact position to display the active tab. However, if there are pinned tabs, when the mouse hovers over the vertical tab bar, the scrollbar will always be at the top.

В этом случае банк блокирует и, если приходит такое требование, списывает сумму, фигурирующую в рамках исполнительного производства. title: UPDATE #1 WITH RESOLUTION:   Firefox update installed yesterday  -  ALL BOOKMARKS APPEAR WIPED
content:
All - I was terrified to sign off my computer last nite, in the event that shutting down would make my missing bookmarks disappear into the ozone layer. But, I did so at midnite. Woke up this morning and when I logged in - BAMM - my bookmarks were all right where they should be, my recent activity history was there so I am here to announce it had to be a user error! Before I noticed the bookmarks were MIA, I had gone thru the setting and review all were as they should be but I never did a restart to make sure all the settings were applied. So when I shut down at midnight, that must have acted as a reboot.

I am getting a new memory stick to back those bookmarks up today and this is resolved!!!


_________________________________________________________________________________________________ An update was installed on April 29, and for the first time, ALL BOOKMARKS appear to be wiped. Have NEVER had this happen in 20 years so hoping it's a simple problem such as a setting change. What's the best place to start or should I just uninstall and go to the last update which was the Firefox 137.0.2 (20250414091429) Installed on: April 15, 2025 at 7:17:18 PM?

The following update from 4/29 wiped my bookmarks. WIN PC Intel 64bit 8GB UPDATE INFO: Firefox 138.0 (20250421163656) Installed on: April 29, 2025 at 5:17:56 PM Status: The Update was successfully installed.

Thank you for your time and consideration. Connie T.

title: Images glitching on desktop
content:
Hello. A while ago, all the images I tried uploading on Firefox started glitching. I thought it was an issue with the formatting of the images (PNG, JPG), but this happens with every single image, no matter what, including GIFs. It also glitches the images on certain sites, but I don't know why. I tried all the troubleshooting suggestions I found, but it is not a problem with my extensions, my antivirus, or my VPN. I also cleared the cache and restarted the browser.

I attached some images so you can see how the corrupted image looks. This does not happen with the same files on Firefox for Android or iOS, just on my desktop browser.

Basically: - I download an image, which can be outside of Firefox, and the image displays perfectly everywhere. - When I try uploading the image to edit online or to simply set it as a profile picture, it corrupts and shows a bunch of colorful lines. - Nothing I have done has solved this issue, and I'm starting to get sad :(

Sorry if this has been asked before, and thank you.
creator: carolinabm.com

title: YouTube will not load properly
content:
Hello,

I apologize if the topic is incorrect, but I didn't know which applied to my situation the best.

Starting on Monday of this week (4/28/2025), YouTube no longer loads properly on Firefox for me. The entire page is covered in video slots with no videos and if I try using a link to a specific video, it will take me to the page, however the video will not load or play, additionally any other elements such as comments or suggested videos will not load. I am using the latest version of Firefox Developer Edition.

I have tried all of the following:

  • disabling all of my add-ons
  • clearing cache, cookies, and history
  • uninstalling and reinstalling Firefox
  • logging in and out of YouTube
  • Reaching out to YouTube (they told me to just use Chrome)

I have asked my friend who also uses Firefox and YouTube works fine for him, so I'm not sure exactly what is making it not work.

Thank you for your time!
creator: florsolitaire
